sentence.Network_en: Bankers are keeping a wary eye on the outcome.
sentence.Network_cn: 银行家们对结果保持高度警惕。

sentence.Network_en: I tried not to tense up, or become obviously wary.
sentence.Network_cn: 我尽量不让自己紧张，或者表现得非常警觉。

sentence.Network_en: He was cautious of his footing, wary of the edge.
sentence.Network_cn: 他小心翼翼地站在边缘。

TOEFL短语词组 ... warn sb. of sth. 告诫 wary of 谨防的；小心翼翼的 waste away 慢慢融化掉；逐渐减少.
taught to be wary of strangers ., 被教知提防陌生人.

entry.def: If you are wary of something or someone, you are cautious because you do not know much about them and you believe they may be dangerous or cause problems.

example.ex: People did not teach their children to be wary of strangers...
example.tran: 过去人们不会教育孩子提防陌生人。

example.ex: They were very wary about giving him a contract.
example.tran: 他们跟他签合同时非常谨慎。

entry.def: If you keep a wary eye on something or someone, you are cautious about them and watch them to see what they will do or what will happen to them.

example.ex: Bankers are keeping a wary eye on the outcome.
example.tran: 银行家们对结果保持高度警惕。

means.word_mean: 1. marked by keen caution and watchful prudence;

sentences.sentence: "a wary glance at the black clouds"

means.word_mean: 2. openly distrustful and unwilling to confide

stems_affixes.value_cn: 未认识到的,未察觉到的,不知道的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un没有,未+aware[adj.意识到的]→adj.未认识到的,未察觉到的,不知道的
aware[adj.意识到的]+ness状态→n.知道, 晓得
